Originally James Harden had a press conference this morning along with many other people but it was delayed for four hours during which tempers flared and harsh words were exchanged. Violence flared up as people scuffled. Several people who dressed in flared jeans were injured in scuffles with the security guards. As fighting flared even some security guards were injured. James went back home before the news conference began because he threw a barbecue party. Some of his friends spilt too much oil when they were barbecuing the steaks causing the barbecue to flare up. There was a sudden flare as his friends were barbecuing some chicken. As time passed the sky was getting darker so they began lighting candles. Some candles flared and flickered. Others flickered and went out. Jsmes Harden let off the fireworks. His sister helped set off the fireworks too. All the rest stood there admiring the flares of the fireworks. After four hours the press conference finally began during which conflict flared up. At one point conflict threatened to flare into a lawsuit. Fortunately after half an hour the conflict quieted down but trouble began to flare up in several cities simultaneously. Harden's sister has lots of clothes in her wardrobe such as a formal dress that flares out into a train, a pair of flares that flares at the ankle, a skirt that flares just above the knees, a pair of chinos that glares just above the ankle and s skirt with flares. James Harden has a horse in his garden. It's funny. When he is late to feed his horse its nostrils will flare in anger then he'll flare his nostrils back to communicate with it. Both James and his sister have a breezy smile and a breezy personality. They're an easy-going type of people who have a breezy manner.

Last Sunday James Harden's cousin Kelvin  threw a party in his apartment where chase eines were served. The sofas in his apartment are made of some cheap material. His television is cheap and nasty. As some of us wanted to watch the news, I said "if I could turn on the tv please" He said "sure. If you would switch to the news channel" Recently he got some new clothes on the cheap from a shop about to go into liquidation. He bought a cheap pair of shoes that fell apart after a couple months so I got him a good quality pair of shoes. He's too cheap to buy new shoes. He's very cheap with the air conditioner too- it's only on for an hour each day and he turns the fans on and opens the windows instead but he got the air conditioner dirt cheap. He holidayed in Macau two months ago but he's so mean he didn't even buy us postcards. He stayed at a three star hotel where it serves cheap and cheerful food and sells cheap and cheerful clothes. Kelvin is a cornetist. He explained to us regarding a piece by clementi "this passage should be played lyrically rather than rhythmically. Otherwise it's a bit cheap." I saw lots of his pencil marks on the score such as cantabile, silence, no pause here, clean pedal, just separate, more melodic voicing, remain soft, stay soft, quiet, hear tenor, clearer, articulate, in time, silvery soft, gentler, take time...Regarding teaching he said "I prefer payment in blocks. My students pay monthly or for four lessons at a time. But for this month it's ok to pay on a lesson-by-lesson basis since you might wanna see what it's like to have lessons. From next month onwards pay monthly. I'm also an accompanist who accompanies singers for live performances. Some of my students started learning the cornet when they were eighteen so their fingers are slower and less dextrous than say a ten year old boy. So start training your fingers when you're still very young so that you can get much faster fingers. It'll improve your finger speed, dexterity, strength and accuracy to a large extent." He asked me to get him some Ravel scores as I can get them on the cheap from a friend of mine. We watched a boxing fight in which Paul hit oscar with a cheap shot after he lost to oscar. We watched a comedy show as well which was full of cheap laughs. The comedian is fanoie for his vulgar manner and wearing a vulgar suit. His granddad was a cheap gangster and liar. His jokes and jibes were cheap and vulgar. Kelvin honours his parents and is thankful for everything they've done for him. His sister is also a good daughter whereas his brother needs to be a better son. In the east parents and teachers stress the importance of filial piety which means chinese parental respect. They teach that you should honour your parents and take care of them. Recently his cousin stole his Chanel watchstrap. It became a point of honour to tell him about it. I felt honour bound to tell him too. His dad is a man of honour and high integrity. His favorite fighter fred will be fighting Dan for the heavyweight title for the honour of his country. Winning it is a matter of personal honoir, family honour and national honour. Last Tuesday Fred's church held a feast in honour of Fred. Kelvin asked if I could do him the honour of accompanying him to the feast which I did. It was a great honour to meet Fred. When fred saw us he said humbly "it's a signal honour to have you here Kelvin" We asked him if he would do us the honour bound of becoming our boxing coach. He said "we'll have to see" A couple of waitresses did the honours and greeted the guests at the door. After we sat down Fred said to a waiter "will you do the honours and cut us a piece of chicken please?" He said to us "I would be honoured if you would come and see my fight in july" We gave him an affirmative response. Last year Dana said to him "I would be honoured if you attended the hall of fame ceremony" which he did. He was honoured for his performance in his last fight.

James Harden's favourite boxer is Fred. Fred was honoured with an award for excellence in boxing. By the way lots of people bought front row tickets for the next event at half price or less due to a computer error but the organisation stated that they would honour these tickets nonetheless which could cost up to one million dollars in lost earnings. James Harden is a God-fearing churcheegoer who says his prayers every night before going to bed. He keeps having flashbacks of a car crash he saw in Osaka after seeing a car accident on the news so yesterday he asked a pastor from the church to pray for him. The church that he attends held a banquet in honour of James. My cousin Sarah asked if I would do her the honour of accompanying her to the banquet which I did. It was a signal honor to see James. When he saw us he said humbly "it's a great honour to have you here sarah" We immediately asked if he would do us the honour of being our basketball coach. He said "We'll see" Five waiters and waitresses did the honours and greeted the guests at the door. After we sat down James said to a waitress "will you do the honours and cut us a piece of chicken breast please?" James said to us "I would be honoured if you could attend our playoff game against Rockets next month" We gave him an affirmative response. Last year his coach said "james I would be honoured if you came to the hall of fame ceremony" which he did. He was honoured for his performance in the last three games. He was honoured with an award for excellence in dribbling and shooting. Loads of NBA fans got front row tickets at half price or less due to a computer problem but NBA has stated that they would honour these tickets nevertheless which could cost up to seven hundred thousand dollars in lost earnings. Sarah is learning Japanese. She tries to learn elevan new vocabulary items a day to enrich her vocabulary. She has a very large vocabulary where her husband has a fairly small vocabulary. She has a vocabulary of around twenty thousand words while her husband has an active vocabulary of about five hundred words. Of course your passive vocabulary is much wider than your active vocabulary. What's the best way of learning new vocabulary ? What's the most ideal way to expand your vocabulary ? Well everybody is different. For sarah it is via reading Japanese novels over and over until you remember every part of the story. For her husband it's through reading, creating sentences with new words in them, writing and pronouncing them. By the way there's heavy traffic on Queens road central right now. I'm held up in traffic in this road. The traffic here is usually fairly light but today it is unusually heavy. Yesterday there was no traffic in this road. Nonetheless I'll leave home easly next time hoping to miss the traffic.
